qas.question: What word literally means a person who stands or walks in front?
For Sunni Islam, what does the word Imam commonly mean?

answers.text: a person who leads the course of prayer in the mosque

qas.question: What does the word madhhab mean?
What does Imam mean in its proper religious context?

answers.text: members of the house of Muhammad designated as infallible

context: The word "<a0_0>Imām<a0_0/>" denotes a person who stands or walks "in front". For Sunni Islam, the word is commonly used to mean <a1_0>a person who leads the course of prayer in the mosque<a1_0/>. It also means the head of a madhhab ("<a2_0>school of thought<a2_0/>"). However, from the Shia point of view this is merely the basic understanding of the word in the Arabic language and, for its proper religious usage, the word "Imam" is applicable only to those <a3_0>members of the house of Muhammad designated as infallible<a3_0/> by the preceding Imam.
